How were the nanobodies against the TREK: By immunizing llamas with purified human TREK-2 protein.
By synthesizing them using recombinant DNA technology.
By isolating them from human blood samples.
By engineering them from mouse monoclonal antibodies.
What is the function of the biparatopic: It significantly increased binding affinity and inhibitory efficacy by targeting different epitopes on TREK-2.
It acts as a universal activator for all K2P channels.
It enhances the immune response by recruiting T-cells.
It functions as a vaccine adjuvant to boost antibody production.
What is the primary focus of the paper t: The development and characterization of nanobodies targeting the TREK-2 K2P potassium channel.
The discovery of new ion channels in camelids.
The genetic modification of llamas to produce human-like antibodies.
The use of nanobodies to treat SARS-CoV-2 infections.
What potential application of nanobodies: Designing nanobodies to target specific epitopes on the SARS-CoV-2 spike protein to block viral entry.
Using nanobodies to enhance the efficacy of existing vaccines.
Developing nanobodies to replace traditional antiviral drugs.
Applying nanobodies to alter the genetic makeup of the virus.
What structural techniques were used to: Atomic force microscopy and Raman spectroscopy.
